Trump administration terminates Citibank consent order prohibiting Armenian American discrimination
The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau terminated a consent order that prohibited Citibank from discriminating against its Armenian American customers.
The agency, led by President Trump’s Office of Management and Budget Director Russ Vought, ended the consent order three years earlier than when it was set to expire.
the bank had already paid more than $24.5 million in penalties and redress payments

Citibank entered into the consent order in November 2023 after it was accused of applying more stringent criteria or even blocking the accounts of credit card applicants in and around Glendale with surnames ending in “ian” and “yan.”

Climate United sued the EPA and Citibank for freezing nearly $7 billion in funding towards decarbonization projects.
The lawsuit is the first of its kind during the second Trump administration.
Climate United is one of three coalitions selected by President Joe Biden’s EPA to disburse $20 billion to decarbonization projects under the Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund (GGRF).
EPA administrator Lee Zeldin releases a social media post accusing Climate United of financially mismanaging the funds designated by the GGRF.
The nearly $7 billion in funding — held in accounts at Citibank — is frozen after Zeldin’s accusations.
Citibank releases its first statement, saying, “Our role as a financial agent does not involve any discretion over which organizations receive grant funds.”
Climate United, the EPA and Citibank appear before the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia in response to the lawsuit.
Can you proffer any evidence that [the grant] was illegal,...

Citibank to stop servicing client accounts in Russia from Nov. 1
Citibank advised clients to transfer their remaining funds to other banks as soon as possible.
Citibank previously halted debit card services, money transfers, cash withdrawals at terminals and transactions via the Central Bank’s Faster Payments System in 2024.
Citigroup first announced plans to sell its Russian consumer business in 2021.
Citibank's loan portfolio has shrunk by 98% since early 2022.
Deposits from individuals and corporate clients have dropped by between 90 and 150 times.
Austria’s Raiffeisen Bank International stopped processing most cross-border transfers last August.
Italy’s UniCredit will stop taking new corporate clients in Russia and raise account servicing fees by up to tenfold.
France’s Societe Generale, Dutch group ING and U.S. bank Goldman Sachs sold their Russian subsidiaries following the invasion of Ukraine.
The Kremlin has blocked Raiffeisenbank’s attempts to sell its Russian subsidiary.
Jason Paniagua has been charged with two counts of bank robbery.
Paniagua robbed the Citibank branch at 69 W. Washington St. on March 27 and April 8.
In the first robbery, Paniagua demanded $100 and $50 bills.
The teller gave Paniagua $340 in cash available in the top drawer.
Paniagua made a purchase with cash at a liquor store in south suburban Harvey after the first robbery.
On April 8, Paniagua again robbed the Citibank, this time pretending a cardboard toilet paper roll was a gun.
Paniagua was arrested after the second robbery with $50 in $5 bills on him.
Paniagua admitted to robbing the Citibank on April 8 after losing his job at Walmart.
Paniagua denied robbing the bank on March 27.
Paniagua made his first court appearance on April 9.
